data.title: Andy Roddick: Movies, Photos, Videos, News, Biography & Birthday
data.meta_description: Andy Roddick: Check out the list of all Andy Roddick movies along with photos, videos, biography and birthday. Also find latest Andy Roddick news on Times of India.
data.text:
Coco Gauff serves up a delight

TNN / Jan 16, 2024, 10:50 (IST)

Coco Gauff's serve is coming of age, which might just be the weapon the 19-year-old needs to augment her sizzling wheels. The world No. 4's new, abbreviated action, a tweaked ball toss, beginning from halfway point, which gives her greater control and marks a consistent delivery.

US Open: Gauff shuts off Gilbert

TNN / Sep 05, 2023, 12:01 (IST)

Coco Gauff had to ask her coach Brad Gilbert to stop giving her advice during her fourth-round match at the US Open. Gauff, who has been working with Gilbert as a consultant, explained that she just wanted to reset and think for herself during certain moments. However, she also praised Gilbert's advice off the court.

Djokovic can 'switch it on during Grand Slam fortnight': Ivanisevic

TNN / Jun 13, 2023, 10:46 (IST)

Every time Novak Djokovic walks onto Court Philippe-Chatrier he scans the arena, taking in the sights. His eyes stayed on some parts more than others.

Is Novak Djokovic the 'Greatest ever'?: What the numbers say

TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Jun 12, 2023, 17:43 (IST)

On Sunday, Djokovic, who won a record-breaking 23rd Grand Slam title at French Open, left his greatest rival Rafael Nadal behind. He now has the most number of major titles among male players in tennis history. Also, with his third title at Roland Garros, Djokovic became the only male tennis player ever to win all the four Slams at least thrice.

Tommy Paul downs Ben Shelton in all-American clash to make Australian Open semis

Reuters / Jan 25, 2023, 13:37 (IST)

Tommy Paul outclassed Ben Shelton 7-6(6), 6-3, 5-7, 6-4 in an all-American clash at the Australian Open on Wednesday to reach his maiden Grand Slam semi-final and become the first man from his country to do so at Melbourne Park since Andy Roddick in 2009.

Berrettini says in running to win Wimbledon after Queen's double

AFP / Jun 20, 2022, 16:26 (IST)

Matteo Berrettini is quietly confident he can win Wimbledon after retaining his Queen's Club title over the weekend to join an elite group of players and continue an impressive return from injury.

Shocking retirements: Five tennis greats who quit at the top

AFP / Mar 23, 2022, 12:23 (IST)

World number one Ashleigh Barty stunned the sporting world by on Wednesday announcing her retirement from tennis aged just 25, weeks after becoming the first home-grown Australian Open champion in 44 years.

Leylah Fernandez pays tribute to New York City on anniversary of 9/11

Reuters / Sep 12, 2021, 09:01 (IST)

Leylah Fernandez may have come up short in the U.S. Open final on Saturday, but the Canadian teen won over the New York crowd after the match when she paid homage to the city's resilience on the 20th anniversary of the Sept. 11 attacks.

Controversial off court, sublime on it, Novak Djokovic on a mission to make history

AFP / Feb 20, 2021, 10:14 (IST)

It's been a turbulent 12 months in the life of Novak Djokovic, but the world number one can put it all behind him by winning a record-extending ninth Australian Open title against Russia's Daniil Medvedev on Sunday.

Ball kids will be relieved of butler duties as tennisâ€™ old etiquette is likely to go post-corona

TNN / May 12, 2020, 22:20 (IST)

The one thing most likely to change when the ATP and WTA Tours chalk the courts again, is ball kids being relieved of butler duties. The towel rack or box, an accommodative feature at courtside that debuted in the Next Gen ATP Finals two years ago, is likely to be a regular feature when the Tours reboot.

Federer's serve a hybrid of Sampras and Agassi: Roddick

IANS / Apr 20, 2020, 18:42 (IST)

Former World No.1 tennis player Andy Roddick heaped praise on 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer, especially for his unique serve technique which according to him is 'frustrating' for his opponents.

Djokovic dismisses report of player boycott

TNN / Jan 16, 2018, 15:01 (IST)

Six-times Australian Open champion Novak Djokovic has distanced himself from reports that he called for a boycott of next year's tournament unless there was an increase in prize money.

Nishikori downs Isner to take Washington title

AFAR / Aug 10, 2015, 12:44 (IST)

Japan's Kei Nishikori took a big step on his road back to the US Open final on Sunday by rallying to defeat John Isner and win the Washington Open title.
